decks.notes: This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ancient Stirrings to find key pieces, while also utilizing cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Blade of the Bloodchief to buff up its creatures. The combo potential of the deck comes from cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to clear the opponent's board while also using Devourer of Destiny and Emrakul, the Promised End to finish the game with massive threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, counter spells, and removal. It aims to control the game by constantly interacting with the opponent's spells and creatures, while also generating card advantage through various means such as drawing cards and forcing the opponent to discard. The deck also includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. It seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a battle of attrition.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The creatures in the deck have abilities that allow for repeated value or protection, such as Flickerwisp and Ephemerate. By combining disruptive elements with aggressive creatures, the deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the deck includes graveyard hate to combat popular graveyard strategies in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Mine, and Power Plant) to quickly ramp into powerful, colorless threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator. It also includes Eldrazi creatures like Devourer of Destiny and Thought-Knot Seer for disruption and board control. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust while also generating card advantage with Ugin's Labyrinth. The key strategy is to establish control early and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats in the mid to late game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of reanimation spells and powerful creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By discarding cards with effects like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour, the player can set up their graveyard for cards like Unearth and Persist to bring back intimidating creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones. This allows the deck to generate significant value and put pressure on the opponent early in the game, leading to a potentially explosive finish.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana using spells like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, while utilizing Ruby Medallion to reduce the cost of spells. It aims to chain together spells and generate a large storm count to win the game with cards like Grapeshot. The deck also includes ways to dig through the deck to find key pieces with cards like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible. Ral, Monsoon Mage can also help generate extra mana while providing card advantage. Wish is included as a versatile card to potentially tutor for key combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using powerful Eldrazi creatures and Tron lands to quickly ramp up to big threats. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer while also having access to strong removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust. The combination of efficient mana production from Urza lands and a strong curve of threats makes this deck a formidable opponent in the Modern format.

The key concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up to powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers. By using cards like Mind Stone and Expedition Map for card advantage and ramp, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with discard effects from Thought-Knot Seer and removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust. Karn, the Great Creator serves as a versatile threat and utility piece, while Ugin, the Eye of the Storms provides additional removal and board control.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of reanimation spells and powerful creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Unearth, Persist, and Faithless Looting, the deck can quickly bring back high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones from the graveyard. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce to control the game and protect its combo pieces. Overall, the strategy focuses on bringing back powerful creatures and overwhelming the opponent with their strong abilities.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck utilizes low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to close out games quickly. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory to give the creatures additional power and resilience. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Seasoned Pyromancer helps control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage efficiently. It aims to control the game by constantly applying pressure on the opponent and utilizing cards like Stubborn Denial to protect its threats. The use of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding helps to boost the power of the creatures and keep the opponent's board in check. The deck also utilizes Tribal Flames to close out the game quickly by dealing a significant amount of damage to the opponent.

This deck focuses on using a combination of cards that do not require traditional lands to generate mana efficiently and quickly, leading to a powerful combo win condition. The key strategy revolves around assembling pieces that allow for a quick and explosive finish, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to respond. The deck offers a mix of disruption, card draw, and protection to support the combo pieces and ensure a high level of consistency in executing the winning sequence.

The deck focuses on using Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to generate a large number of creature tokens, while leveraging Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt the opponent. It also includes powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Promised End and Delighted Halfling to close out the game. With a mix of ramp, removal, and synergy between creatures and artifacts, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong combo-based strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard manipulation to bring powerful creatures back into play as quickly as possible, creating a powerful reanimation combo. By discarding creatures with cards like Faithless Looting and Village Rites, and sacrificing creatures like Bloodghast and Stitcher's Supplier, players can quickly fill their graveyard with targets for cards like Persist and Archon of Cruelty. Once these creatures are in the graveyard, they can be brought back into play with cards like Souls of the Lost, creating a powerful board presence and overwhelming the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while quickly building up a board presence. It combines aggressive creatures with disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the game. Utilizing flickering effects with cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd ensures that you can maintain pressure on your opponent. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggro and disruptive elements.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to maintain card advantage, slow down the opponent's game plan, and eventually win through incremental advantage and powerful planeswalker threats like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. Additionally, the inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides an additional creature threat and synergizes well with the deck's control elements. The deck prioritizes maintaining control of the game and outvaluing the opponent over aggressive strategies.
